chantedPrayers.text:
LIBERATING PRAYER

O Blessed One, Shakyamuni Buddha,
Precious treasury of compassion,
Bestower of supreme inner peace,
You, who love all beings without exception,
Are the source of happiness and goodness;
And you guide us to the liberating path.

Your body is a wishfulfilling jewel,
Your speech is supreme, purifying nectar,
And your mind is refuge for all living beings.

With folded hands I turn to you,
Supreme unchanging friend,
I request from the depths of my heart:

Please give me the light of your wisdom
To dispel the darkness of my mind
And to heal my mental continuum.

Please nourish me with your goodness,
That I in turn may nourish all beings
With an unceasing banquet of delight.

Through your compassionate intention,
Your blessings and virtuous deeds,
And my strong wish to rely upon you,
May all suffering quickly cease
And all happiness and joy be fulfilled;
And may holy Dharma flourish for evermore.

GOING FOR REFUGE

I and all sentient beings, until we achieve enlightenment,
Go for refuge to Buddha, Dharma and Sangha. (3x)

GENERATING BODHICHITTA

Through the virtues I collect by giving and other perfections,
May I become a Buddha for the benefit of all. (3x)

GENERATING THE FOUR IMMEASURABLES

May everyone be happy,
May everyone be free from misery,
May no one ever be separated from their happiness,
May everyone have equanimity, free from hatred and attachment.

VISUALIZING THE FIELD FOR ACCUMULATING MERIT

In the space before me is the living Buddha Shakyamuni surrounded by all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, like the full moon surrounded by stars.

PRAYER OF SEVEN LIMBS

With my body, speech and mind, humbly I prostrate,
And make offerings both set out and imagined.
I confess my wrong deeds from all time,
And rejoice in the virtues of all.
Please stay until samsara ceases,
And turn the Wheel of Dharma for us.
I dedicate all virtues to great enlightenment.

OFFERING THE MANDALA

The ground sprinkled with perfume and spread with flowers,
The Great Mountain, four lands, sun and moon,
Seen as a Buddha Land and offered thus,
May all beings enjoy such Pure Lands.

I offer without any sense of loss
The objects that give rise to my attachment, hatred and confusion,
My friends, enemies and strangers, our bodies and enjoyments;
Please accept these and bless me to be released directly from the three poisons.

IDAM GURU RATNA MANDALAKAM NIRYATAYAMI

PRAYER OF THE STAGES OF THE PATH

The path begins with strong reliance
On my kind Teacher, source of all good;
O Bless me with this understanding
To follow him with great devotion.

This human life with all its freedoms,
Extremely rare, with so much meaning;
O Bless me with this understanding
All day and night to seize its essence.

My body, like a water bubble,
Decays and dies so very quickly;
After death come results of karma,
Just like the shadow of a body.

With this firm knowledge and remembrance
Bless me to be extremely cautious,
Always avoiding harmful actions
And gathering abundant virtue.

Samsara's pleasures are deceptive,
Give no contentment, only torment;
So please bless me to strive sincerely
To gain the bliss of perfect freedom.

O Bless me so that from this pure thought
Come mindfulness and greatest caution,
To keep as my essential practice
The doctrine's root, the Pratimoksha.

Just like myself all my kind mothers
Are drowning in samsara's ocean;
O So that I may soon release them,
Bless me to train in bodhichitta.

But I cannot become a Buddha
By this alone without three ethics;
So bless me with the strength to practice
The Bodhisattva's ordination.

By pacifying my distractions
And analyzing perfect meanings,
Bless me to quickly gain the union
Of special insight and quiescence.

When I become a pure container
Through common paths, bless me to enter
The essence practice of good fortune,
The supreme vehicle, Vajrayana.

The two attainments both depend on
My sacred vows and my commitments;
Bless me to understand this clearly
And keep them at the cost of my life.

By constant practice in four sessions,
The way explained by holy Teachers,
O Bless me to gain both the stages,
Which are the essence of the Tantras.

May those who guide me on the good path,
And my companions all have long lives;
Bless me to pacify completely
All obstacles, outer and inner.

May I always find perfect Teachers,
And take delight in holy Dharma,
Accomplish all grounds and paths swiftly,
And gain the state of Vajradhara.

RECEIVING BLESSINGS AND PURIFYING

From the hearts of all the holy beings, streams of light and nectar flow down, granting blessings and purifying.

guidedMeditation.speaker: Kadam Kyle
guidedMeditation.text: Why is our present state of existence considered to be so rare and so difficult to attain?

guidedMeditation.speaker: Kadam Kyle
guidedMeditation.text:
Every effect has a cause. And our present existence as human beings and as specially endowed human beings is a result of a number of specific and hard to create causes. In general, birth as a human depends upon having previously practiced pure moral discipline and giving.

Specifically, each aspect of a fully endowed human life has its own appropriate cause. Furthermore, in order to have attained this life, we must have generated pure thoughts or prayers to receive a bodily vehicle with which we would have the leisure and ability to improve our mind through the continued practice of Dharma or spiritual teachings. To be effective, such prayers have to be unpolluted by attachment to temporal comforts and happiness as it is rare that we create even one of these causes.

It follows that the fruit resulting from a combination of them must be extremely rare to find.

guidedMeditation.speaker: Kadam Kyle
guidedMeditation.text: Our fully endowed human life has so many unique hard to create effects all occurring at one time where in most lives we have zero of them or just maybe one. The people in our past lives who are reflecting on these points can transform our mind into a determination thinking like this, precious human life and these freedoms and endowments I must practice Dharma just hold this determination single pointedly for the final couple of minutes and then in our own time we can gradually arise more practice.

shantidevaReading.speaker: Kadam Kyle
shantidevaReading.text:
Homage to the enlightened Buddhas and bodhisattvas. I prostrate to the enlightened Buddhas endowed with the truth body and to the bodhisattvas and all other objects of prostration. I'll explain briefly, in accordance with the scriptures, how to engage in the condensed practices of the bodhisattva.

There's nothing written here that has not been explained before, and I have no special skills in composition. My reason for writing this is to benefit others and to keep my mind acquainted. Thus, the strength of my faith in my virtuous realizations might for a while be increased by this, and perhaps others who are as fortunate as I might also find this meaningful to behold.

This precious human life, so hard to find, offers the ultimate goal for living beings. If we do not strive to accomplish this goal now, how will such a precious opportunity arise again? Just as on a dark and cloudy night, a flash of lightning for a moment eliminates all, so for the worldly, through the power of Buddha's blessings, a virtuous intention occasionally and briefly occurs.

Thus, while our virtues are mostly weak, our non-virtues are extremely strong and fearsome. Other than Bodhicitta, a compassionate mind wishing for enlightenment, what virtue can overcome the heaviest evils? The able ones, the Buddhas, who have considered this for many eons, have all seen Bodhicitta to be the most beneficial, because through it, countless masses of living beings can easily attain the supreme bliss of enlightenment.

Those who wish to destroy their own suffering, those who wish to dispel the suffering of others, and those who wish to experience much happiness, should never forsake the practice of Bodhicitta. The moment Bodhicitta is generated, even in pitiful beings bound within the prison of samsara, they become bodhisattvas, the son or daughter of Buddha, and are worthy of veneration by humans and worldly gods. Just like the supreme elixir that transmutes into gold, Bodhicitta can transform this impure body we have taken into the priceless jewel of a Buddha's form.

Therefore, firmly maintain Bodhicitta. Since the limitless wisdom of Buddha, the sole navigator of living beings, upon through investigation has seen its preciousness, those who wish to be free from samsara's sufferings should firmly maintain this precious mind of Bodhicitta. Whereas all other virtues are like plantain trees, in that they are exhausted once they bear fruit, the enduring celestial tree of Bodhicitta is not exhausted but increases by bearing fruit.

Just as when those who are greatly afraid rely upon a courageous one, whoever relies upon Bodhicitta will immediately be freed from danger, even if they've committed unbearable evils. So why do the conscientious not rely upon it? Just like the fire at the end of the aeon, in an instant it completely consumes all great evil.

Its countless benefits were explained by the wise protector Maitreya to Bodhisattva Sudhana.

I'm not going to be helping people.

I came away actually feeling very discouraged by that, as I really imagined it. So I'm kind of not in a, I don't know, I'm okay, but I obviously didn't get the practice. So I don't know.

Yeah, I think it's like we're trying to imagine enlightenment from an incredibly unenlightened point of view, at least speaking for myself, like mind-bogglingly far away from actually being enlightened. Not in the sense of induration, because we're close from that point of view, but in the experience point of view. We're living in a completely opposite world than the enlightened mind.

And so when we try to get our mind around that, that can feel discouraged, but it's principally because what we're imagining and envisioning is completely, utterly different than what our enlightenment will be like. So for example, those people that we're trying to help, that maybe we feel like, oh, it's not moving, it's not working. For most of us, those are the people we normally see.

Those are inherently existent people that we're seeing. For a Buddha, inherently existent people don't appear at all. So it's like we're trying to help inherently existent people, and that's incredibly frustrating and difficult.

Buddhas don't even see inherently existent people. There's not even an appearance of an inherently existent ordinary person to a Buddha's mind. So it's a very different operation going on.

So I would play around with that a little bit, with getting that sense of encouragement around benefiting others. How is thinking of them as inherent or ordinary, how is that actually where the discouragement can come from? Versus if I think about them as mere name, and helping mere name people be free of their mere name suffering, how is that actually much more encouraging?

I'll try to bring the transcript next class from Geshe about this, because he's given some really crucial teachings on taking and giving about this, explaining this point. He's saying why do people have a hard time with taking and giving? It's because they're trying to take inherent suffering from inherent suffering people.

But you're actually just taking mere name suffering from mere name people. It's very helpful, I think. It's just a nice area to explore.

I get what you're saying. It can be really discouraging seeing how difficult it is to benefit people. But it's also an invitation to look at our own mind and how we are viewing them, and work on that a little bit.

An Explanation of the Benefits of Bodhicitta. As indicated before, the supreme method for making this rare and precious human rebirth meaningful is to use it as a vehicle for attaining the most perfect and complete enlightenment. To work for any lesser goal is to throw away this unique opportunity.

Since the attainment of enlightenment depends upon first developing the mind of enlightenment, bodhicitta, the motivation to achieve full enlightenment in order to be most effective in helping others out of their suffering, Shantideva encourages us to develop bodhicitta and describes its many advantages. These are divided into the following ten outstanding benefits. So I sent along my little acronym that I use to remember the ten.

CON-E-VIP-SUS Two S's at the end. Very helpful. Very easy to remember if you get the little acronym down.

CON-QUEST is the C. ATTAINMENT is the A. WISH FULFILLMENT is the W.

SPECIAL NAME AND MEANING is the N. TRANSFORMATION OF THE INFERIOR INTO THE SUPREME is the I. CON-E-VIP-SUS VALUE OF THE SUPREME BODHICITTA So hard to find.

That's the. INCREASING EXHAUSTIBLE BENEFITS OF BODHICITTA That's the second I. POWER OF PROTECTION FROM GREAT FEAR is the P.

SWIFT AND EASY DESTRUCTION OF GREAT EVIL That's the first S. SCRIPTURAL CITATIONS is the second S. CON-E-VIP-SUS EASY So it's good to learn these ten off by heart.

Just have them. It doesn't have to be perfectly worded, but just the gist. These ten are ten individual meditations.

And what I would really encourage us to do over the next week at least is to try to either do one a day and just keep it as like something that you are remembering throughout the day. It could be in your succession practice or other times. So either do one a day or like match the successions with six a day.

If you want to do that in the first session, and then the attainment of the most sublime happiness in the second session, a wish fulfillment in the third, etc., then that's great too. But what we want to do is get a special feeling for all ten. And we need to kind of milk them a little bit. You need to work them a little bit to get a special feeling for each one so that they touch your heart.

So having some kind of systematic way to do this is the way to start connecting to these.
